sense.gloss: to fill, to become full (of), to be filled (with), to brim (with)
to rise (of the tide), to flow, to come in
to expire (of a period of time), to mature, to come to an end

sdata.j: ↑世界↑↓せかい↓↑遺産↑↓いさん↓でもある↑宮島↑↓みやじま↓の「↑厳島↑↓いつくしま↓↑神社↑↓じんじゃ↓」は、↑潮↑↓しお↓が|↑満↑↓み↓ちる|と↑神社↑↓じんじゃ↓↑全体↑↓ぜんたい↓がまるで↑海↑↓うみ↓に↑浮↑↓う↓かんでいるかのように↑見↑↓み↓えます。その↑姿↑↓すがた↓は↑神秘↑↓しんぴ↓↑的↑↓てき↓で、↑世界中↑↓せかいじゅう↓から↑訪↑↓おとず↓れる↑観光↑↓かんこう↓↑客↑↓きゃく↓を↑魅了↑↓みりょう↓し↑続↑↓つづ↓けています。
sdata.e: Also known for being a world heritage site, the Itsukushima Shrine in Miyajima gives the impression that it is floating in the ocean whenever the tides come in. Its mystical appearance continues to attract tourists from all over the world.
